description: This eventful loop follows the Homebush Bay foreshore through the Badu Mangroves to the Oympic Park and Newington Nature Reserve, before crossing the river and following the Parramatta River Walk back.

markers.description: Get the train to Rhodes using transportnsw.info.
From the station follow Walker St to the left. There are amenities across from the station.
From the corner of Walker St, follow Mary St to the right down to the shorefront.
Cross Shoreline Dr into the foreshore park.
Follow the waterfront footpath to the left.
Follow the path right into Lewis Berger Park.
Follow the path right through the carpark.
Follow the shared path through the park land along the mangroves.
At the intersection follow the path to the right into the mangroves.
Cross the first bridge into the mangroves.
Before the second bridge follow the footpath to the left.
After the playground cross the bridge to the right.
From the bridge follow the steps straight on.
At the top of the steps follow the path around the Treillage Tower.
Cross the length of the water feature.
Cross Bicentennial Dr and continue straight on the footpath.
Cross the bridge across the Bennelong Pkwy to the right.
Cross the square on the other side of the overpass to the railway underpass.
After the railway underpass cross Australia Ave at the bus stop.
After crossing follow Australia Ave to the right.
At the playground follow Herb Elliott Ave to the left.
There are public toilets on the right side of Elliott Ave at the Abattoir Precinct.
Follow the steps on the right through the Abattoir Precinct to Olympic Park Station.
From the steps follow Dawn Fraser Ave to the right, past the amenities.
At the intersection follow Australia Ave to the left.
Follow the footpath along Australia Ave past Brickpit Park.
Cross Marjorie Jackson Pkwy and continue straight on Holker Busway across the bridge.
Mist from those three poles created a rainbow gate to the Olympics.
markers.title: Former Glory
markers.instruction: Visit this location to earn the mystery trophy

markers.description: There are public toilets at the carpark across the bridge.
Past the surf pool cross Hill Rd at the traffic light.
After crossing follow Hill Rd to the right.
Enter the gate into the wetlands on the left.
Follow the trail through the wetlands.
On the other side of the wetlands follow Louise Sauvage Pathway to the right.
This tiny train line leads all the way to icecream.
markers.title: Choo Choo Time
markers.instruction: Visit this location to earn the mystery trophy

markers.description: At the intersection follow the sign to the River Walk.
At the intersection before Balloderry Hill follow the path to the left to the River Walk.
At the intersection after Balloderry Hill follow the path to the left to the River Walk.
At the riverside follow the River Walk to the left.
Follow the River Walk past the Newington Armory.
There is a restaurant at the Newington Armory.
There are public toilets a short distance past the Newington Armory.
There are public toilets at the bike hire.
At the end of the Riverwalk follow the shared path under the Silverwater Bridge.
On the other side follow the footpath left around the park to the bridge ramp.
Follow the footpath to the left across the Silverwater Bridge.
After crossing the bridge follow the footpath left into the Eric Primrose Reserve.
Follow the footpath left underneath the Silverwater Bridge.
There is a cafe at Halvorsen Park along the riverside.
Follow the riveride path up the elevation to George Kendall Riverside Park.
Follow the shared path around the right ride of George Kendall Riverside Park.
After the park follow the sign to Meadowbank to the right.
Follow the boardwalk through the mangroves.
At the intersection follow the shared path to the right.
From the end of the path continue on Waratah St to the Ermington Boat Ramp.
There's a toilet block at the boat ramp.
From the boat ramp follow the footpath to Melrose Park.
After the playground follow Lancaster Ave to the right.
From the corner of Lancaster Ave follow the footpath to the right.
From the intersection follow the shared path right along the sportsfields.
From the sportsfields follow the shared path under the John Whitton Bridge to the ferry wharf.
From the cafe at the ferry wharf follow the steps up along the left side of the appartments.
From the steps follow Bay Dr left.
Follow the ramp up to the bridge to the left side of Bay Dr.
From the intersection at the top of the ramp, follow the shared path left across the bridge.
Cross the John Whitton Bridge along the shared path.
After crossing the bridge follow the ramp down to Blaxland Rd to the left.
From the ramp follow Blaxland Rd to the left to the boat ramp.
From the boat ramp follow the footpath underneath the beidge.
On the other side of the bridge follow the shared path along the waterfront.
Follow the shared path underneath the Bennelong Bridge and past the cafe.
After the park follow the path left to Shoreline Dr.
Cross Shoreline Dr and follow Mary St straight ahead towards the train line.
From the corner of Mary St follow Walker St to the left to the train station.
Plan your return trip from Rhodes at transportnsw.info.
